decks.notes: The deck focuses on assembling the Saheeli Rai and Felidar Guardian combo to create infinite copies of Felidar Guardian, allowing for repeated enters-the-battlefield triggers. This creates a loop that can either provide infinite damage with Needle Spires or trigger another powerful card like Torrential Gearhulk. The deck's other cards provide control elements to protect the combo pieces until it can be assembled. It aims to control the board with removal spells like Immolating Glare and counterspells like Disallow while digging through the deck with cards like Glimmer of Genius and Anticipate.

This deck revolves around creating a combo with Felidar Guardian and Saheeli Rai to generate infinite copies of the Guardian and trigger powerful effects. By using cards like Oath of Nissa and Rogue Refiner to filter through the deck, along with Harnessed Lightning for removal and protection, the player can quickly assemble the combo pieces. Additional cards like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Ajani Unyielding provide additional value and card advantage. The mana base is designed to support the combo and ensure consistency in pulling off the combo.

The deck focuses on creating a powerful combo using Saheeli Rai and Felidar Guardian to create infinite copies of Felidar Guardian, generating infinite enters-the-battlefield triggers and potentially winning the game on the spot. The deck includes various control elements to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy, allowing for a smooth execution of the combo. Additionally, the deck includes card draw and card selection spells to help find the combo pieces quickly and efficiently.

This Jeskai Control deck focuses on using counterspells and removal spells to control the board, while generating card advantage through card draw and using powerful finishers like Torrential Gearhulk. The deck aims to stall the game, deal with threats efficiently, and eventually take over the game with its powerful card advantage engines and win conditions. Flexibility and resource management are key elements of this deck, allowing the player to adapt to different situations and outvalue their opponents in the long run.

The deck revolves around the combo between Felidar Guardian and Saheeli Rai, creating an infinite loop of blinking and copying creatures to overwhelm the opponent. It also includes control elements such as counterspells like Disallow and removal spells like Harnessed Lightning to protect the combo pieces. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo while protecting it and controlling the board with removal spells and counterspells to secure victory.

This deck focuses on using powerful creatures with +1/+1 counters to quickly overwhelm your opponent and deal damage efficiently. By utilizing cards like Glint-Sleeve Siphoner and Winding Constrictor, you can generate card advantage and pump up your creatures. With support from removal spells like Fatal Push and Grasp of Darkness, you can keep your opponent's board under control while building up your own. The synergy between cards like Verdurous Gearhulk and Rishkar, Peema Renegade allow for explosive turns and massive swings in tempo. The goal is to maintain pressure and close out the game before your opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to quickly fill the board with strong creatures like Verdurous Gearhulk and Walking Ballista, supported by cards like Winding Constrictor and Rishkar, Peema Renegade to boost their power and toughness. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures while also having removal options like Fatal Push and Grasp of Darkness to deal with threats. The inclusion of cards like Grim Flayer and Mindwrack Demon provide additional card advantage and graveyard synergy. The deck also includes utility cards like Traverse the Ulvenwald for consistency and flexibility.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence using creatures with +1/+1 counters and taking advantage of the synergy between Winding Constrictor and the creatures that produce +1/+1 counters. The deck aims to apply pressure early in the game with aggressive creatures like Grim Flayer and Walking Ballista, while also utilizing cards like Traverse the Ulvenwald to search for key creatures or lands. The deck also includes removal spells like Grasp of Darkness and Fatal Push to deal with opposing threats and maintain board control.

This deck focuses on utilizing low-cost creatures to quickly build a strong board presence and put pressure on the opponent. By playing aggressive creatures like Metallic Mimic, Town Gossipmonger, and Thalia's Lieutenant, followed by powerful support cards like Always Watching and Thalia, Heretic Cathar, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early in the game. The inclusion of removal spells like Outnumber and Incendiary Flow helps to clear the way for your creatures to continue attacking. With a mix of efficient creatures and spells, this deck aims to win the game quickly through aggressive plays.

This deck focuses on assembling the Saheeli Rai and Felidar Guardian combo to create infinite copies of the Guardian, allowing for a win condition through attacking or other synergies. The deck includes cards that help generate energy and fix mana, as well as card draw and removal to control the game until the combo can be assembled. The deck aims to be fast and efficient in executing the combo while disrupting the opponent's game plan, ultimately leading to a decisive victory.

The main concept of this deck is to create an infinite combo loop using Felidar Guardian and Saheeli Rai. By continually blinking the Guardian with Saheeli's ability, you can create infinite tokens of the Guardian, which triggers various effects like drawing cards with Cloudblazer or tapping down your opponent's creatures with Elder Deep-Fiend. In addition to the combo pieces, the rest of the deck is focused on ramping up mana with cards like Servant of the Conduit and Attune with Aether, as well as providing card advantage and utility with cards like Rogue Refiner and Whirler Virtuoso.

This deck focuses on creating an infinite combo loop with Saheeli Rai and Felidar Guardian, allowing you to continuously copy the Felidar Guardian and generate infinite hasty tokens. The deck includes control elements like counterspells and removal to protect the combo and disrupt your opponent's strategy. The mana base is built to support the combo while also providing flexibility for casting spells. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces as quickly as possible to overwhelm your opponent and secure victory.

The deck revolves around creating a powerful combo using Felidar Guardian and Saheeli Rai to create infinite copies of Felidar Guardian, allowing for multiple triggered abilities and potentially overwhelming the opponent. The deck also includes control elements like counterspells and removal spells to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's strategies. The mana base is designed to support the combo pieces as well as provide consistency in casting spells. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble the combo while controlling the game to secure a win.

The deck is focused on aggressively deploying Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm the opponent quickly. The key strategy involves using cards like Metallic Mimic and Thought-Knot Seer to benefit from tribal synergies and disrupt the opponent's hand. Elder Deep-Fiend can be used to tap down the opponent's blockers and push for a decisive victory. The mana base is designed to support the Eldrazi creatures with a mix of color-producing lands and utility lands. Removal spells like Harnessed Lightning and Shock help clear the way for your aggressive Eldrazi creatures to deal damage efficiently.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a strong board presence with creatures like Walking Ballista, Grim Flayer, and Verdurous Gearhulk. It uses cards like Winding Constrictor and Rishkar, Peema Renegade to pump up creatures and generate value. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Grasp of Darkness to control the opponent's board. Traverse the Ulvenwald helps to find key creatures or lands, while Noxious Gearhulk and Mindwrack Demon provide additional threats and value. The deck aims to apply pressure early and overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive creatures.

This deck focuses on aggressive play using red and black cards to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It uses cards like Fatal Push and Lightning Axe for removal, while also utilizing cards like Cathartic Reunion and Key to the City for card advantage. The goal is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Scrapheap Scrounger and Prized Amalgam to generate value and pressure on the opponent. Voldaren Pariah and Distended Mindbender provide powerful late-game threats to close out the game. The deck also includes Haunted Dead and Cryptbreaker for additional synergy and graveyard manipulation.
